text: Note base R plots typically produce graphical output directly current graphics device, without assigning result variable. design, reproducibleRchunks package tracks metadata variables explicitly created within code chunk. Since standard plotting commands involve variable assignment, output checked reproducibility. See following example, newly declared variables x y subject reproducibility check plot: ✅x: REPRODUCTION SUCCESSFUL ✅y: REPRODUCTION SUCCESSFUL Note function recordPlot() records plot graphics device. However result object contains system-specific information local paths R’s, internal libraries R version used process id, makes reproducibility checks plots base R futile.
